subject: Real Estate
title: Foreclosure Wave: 10 Million Families
description: A micro-lesson that makes Foreclosure Wave: 10 Million Families usable.

hook.text: Between 2007 and 2012, nearly 10 million American families lost their homes to foreclosure.

buildup.text: Falling prices left borrowers 'underwater' â€” owing more on the mortgage than the house was worth.

discovery.text: Banks processed foreclosures so fast they used 'robo-signers' who approved thousands of files without reading them.

twist.text: Many foreclosures were later found to be illegal. Banks had forged documents and signatures.

climax.text: Families lost homes, neighborhoods emptied, and property values in foreclosure zones cratered further.

punchline.text: Banks foreclosed so fast they forgot to read the paperwork.

quiz.question: What are 'robo-signers'?
options: Employees who approved foreclosures without review
